name: Input
description: Input fields allow users to enter and edit text. They are a fundamental form element used for collecting user data, from simple text to complex structured information.

overview.purpose: Inputs are the primary method for users to provide textual information. Well-designed inputs reduce errors, improve completion rates, and create confidence in the interface.
principles: Labels should always be visible - don't rely on placeholder text alone
Provide immediate validation feedback when possible
Use appropriate input types to trigger correct mobile keyboards
Support autocomplete to reduce user effort

whenNotToUse: When there are fewer than 7 predefined options - use Select or Radio instead
For binary choices - use Checkbox or Toggle
When voice or other input methods are more appropriate

anatomy.description: An input field consists of multiple elements that provide context, guidance, and feedback.

parts.name: Label
parts.description: Descriptive text that identifies what information is expected

parts.name: Input Container
parts.description: The bordered area where text is entered

parts.name: Placeholder
parts.description: Hint text shown when the field is empty. Should be an example, not instruction

parts.name: Helper Text
parts.description: Additional context or requirements shown below the input

parts.name: Leading Element
parts.description: Icon or text prefix (like currency symbol) at the start of input

parts.name: Trailing Element
parts.description: Icon, button, or text suffix at the end of input (clear button, visibility toggle)

parts.name: Character Count
parts.description: Shows current/maximum characters when limits apply

variants.name: Default
variants.description: Standard text input for general use

variants.name: Email
variants.description: Input optimized for email addresses with @ keyboard on mobile

variants.name: Password
variants.description: Masked input with visibility toggle for secure entries

variants.name: Search
variants.description: Input styled for search functionality with clear button

variants.name: Number
variants.description: Input restricted to numeric values with optional stepper

variants.name: Phone
variants.description: Formatted input for phone numbers with country selector

sizes.name: Small
sizes.useCase: Compact forms, table cells, dense UIs

sizes.name: Medium
sizes.useCase: Default for most forms and contexts

states.name: Default
states.description: Empty or filled state at rest

states.name: Hover
states.description: Visual feedback when cursor enters the input area

states.name: Focus
states.description: Active state when input has keyboard focus. Shows focus ring.

states.name: Disabled
states.description: Input cannot be interacted with. Reduced opacity.

states.name: Read-only
states.description: Value can be viewed and copied but not edited

states.name: Error
states.description: Validation failed. Shows error styling and message.

props.name: helperText
props.description: Help text displayed below the input

props.name: leadingIcon
props.description: Icon displayed at the start of the input

props.name: trailingIcon
props.description: Icon displayed at the end of the input

props.name: onChange
props.description: Handler called when the value changes

props.name: onBlur
props.description: Handler called when the input loses focus

tokens.description: Design tokens used by the Input component

accessibility.description: Form inputs must be accessible to all users, including those using screen readers and keyboard navigation.

guidelines.title: Labels
guidelines.description: Always associate labels with inputs using htmlFor/id or wrapping. Never use placeholder as sole label.

guidelines.title: Error Messages
guidelines.description: Link error messages to inputs using aria-describedby. Announce errors to screen readers.

guidelines.title: Required Fields
guidelines.description: Indicate required fields visually and programmatically (aria-required)

guidelines.title: Autocomplete
guidelines.description: Use autocomplete attribute to help browsers autofill common fields

guidelines.title: Input Purpose
guidelines.description: Use appropriate input types to enable browser autofill and mobile keyboards

do: Always use visible labels above the input
Provide helpful placeholder text as examples, not instructions
Show validation errors inline, near the field
Use appropriate input types (email, tel, number)
Support browser autocomplete for common fields
Show character counts for limited fields
dont: Don't use placeholder text as the only label
Don't validate on every keystroke - wait for blur or submit
Don't disable paste in password fields
Don't use custom validation for standard formats (email)
Don't clear the form after validation errors
Don't require specific formatting without mask/help

examples.title: Input with Helper Text
examples.code:
<Input 
  label="Email" 
  type="email" 
  helperText="We'll never share your email" 
/>

examples.title: Input with Error
examples.code:
<Input 
  label="Password" 
  type="password" 
  error="Password must be at least 8 characters" 
/>
